00016 /* Maximum IPC reading timeout */
00017 #define ICIPC_MAXRDTIMEOUT     300000
00018 
00019 /* Tick Task - tick sending interval value in milliseconds */
00020 #define ICTTTICK   100
00021 
00022 /*************
00023  *
00024  * Name:    icsmtcb
00025  *
00026  * Purpose: Structure that implements a shared-memory an inter-task
00027  *          messaging facility.
00028  *
00029  * Members: icsmtputp    - Location to put the next message to
00030  *          icsmtgetp    - Location to get the next message from
00031  *          icsmtstartp  - Pointer to the start of the message area
00032  *          icsmtendp    - Pointer to the last entry in the msg area
00033  *          icsmtqnamep  - Pointer to a caller-supplied string
00034  *          icsmtrcvcnt  - counts received messages since reset
00035  *          icsmtsendcnt - counts messages that has been sent since reset
00036  *          icsmtmaxqueued - maximum messages that were on  a queue
00037  *          icsmtwaiter  - Waiter structure. Allows the thread that
00038  *                         owns this structure to block waiting for
00039  *                         incoming messages
00040  *          issmtsem     - Semaphore structure used by callers to
00041  *                         obtain exclusive access to this structure
00042  *          mstimeout      signal the registered client periodically every
00043  *                         mstimeout seconds.
00044  *          msruntime      running count-down of mstimeout
00045  *
00046  * Notes:   For use by threads within the SDK process only
00047  *
00048  *          Later when this SDK needs to support 64 bit architectures,
00049  *          another declaration for the pointers below will be needed.
00050  *          This can wait until the next release when we have time to
00051  *          fix this properly
00052  *
00053  **************/
00054 struct icsmtcb
00055 {
00056     swi_uint32 *icsmtputp;
00057     swi_uint32 *icsmtgetp;
00058     swi_uint32 *icsmtstartp;
00059     swi_uint32 *icsmtendp;
00060     swi_uint8  *icsmtqnamep;
00061     swi_uint32 icsmtrcvcnt;
00062     swi_uint32 icsmtsendcnt;
00063     swi_uint32 icsmtmaxqueued;
00064     swi_uint32 mstimeout;
00065     swi_uint32 msrunttime;
00066     /* Structures from other packages */
00067     struct swi_oswaiter icsmtwaiter;
00068     struct swi_ossemaphore icsmtsem;
00069 };
00070 
00071 /*************
00072  *
00073  * Name:    icipccb
00074  *
00075  * Purpose: Structure that implements a control block for
00076  *          packages needing to use IPC facilities
00077  *
00078  * Members: icipcip      - OS package ipc control block structure
00079  *          icipcopen    - Flag to indicate whether the channel has
00080  *                         been opened yet. Must be open before send
00081  *                         or receive can be done
00082  *          icipcindex   - The internal representation of the IPC name
00083  *                         being used by the caller
00084  *          icipcsdktoapidropped
00085  *                       - The number of sdk to api messages dropped due to API
00086  *                         side not there for this channel.
00087  * Notes:   none
00088  *
00089  **************/
00090 struct icipccb
00091 {
00092     struct swi_osipc icipcip;
00093     swi_bool         icipcopen;
00094     swi_size_t       icipcindex;
00095     swi_uint32       icipcsdktoapidropped;
00096 };
00097 
00098 /*
00099  * Name:    icttregqblk
00100  *
00101  * Purpose: Registration Queue Block.
00102  *
00103  * Members:
00104  *          ictticsmtp   - pointer to where to send the tick message
00105  *          ictttickmsg  - tick message to send
00106  *          icttqlink    - queue link
00107  *
00108  * Note:    Caller identification string is in ictticsmt.
00109  *
00110  */
00111 struct icttregqblk
00112 {
00113     struct icsmtcb  *ictticsmtp;
00114     swi_uint32      ictttickmsg;
00115     struct qllink   icttqlink;
00116 };
